net.webpdf.ant

Class WebPDFTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.tools.ant.ProjectComponent
      • org.apache.tools.ant.Task
        • net.webpdf.ant.task.Task
          • net.webpdf.ant.WebPDFTask
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable, TaskIntf, org.apache.tools.ant.TaskContainer

    public class WebPDFTask
extends Task
implements org.apache.tools.ant.TaskContainer
    This task is representing the top level of the webPDF ANT task. It shall contain all basic configurations necessary to connect to the webPDF server and shall share those connection details with all contained sub tasks.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class org.apache.tools.ant.Task

      • Fields inherited from class org.apache.tools.ant.ProjectComponent

    • Constructor Detail

      • WebPDFTask

        public WebPDFTask()
        An instance of this class is representing the top level of the webPDF ANT task. It shall contain all basic configurations necessary to connect to the webPDF server and shall share those connection details with all contained sub tasks. It must be contained and is providing the basic context for all webservice calls.

        It may contain either grouped operations or operation definitions themselves.

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public void execute()
             throws org.apache.tools.ant.BuildException
        Central method to execute a task and all it's sub tasks. This method shall prepare and provide the needed context and shall execute it's sub tasks sequentially in an ordered fashion.
        Specified by:
        execute in interface TaskIntf
        Specified by:
        execute in class Task
        Throws:
        org.apache.tools.ant.BuildException - if something goes wrong with the build.

      • addTask

        public void addTask(org.apache.tools.ant.Task task)
        Method to add sub elements to this tag. This shall be used by ant access methods and shall treat each appended element according to it's type.
        Specified by:
        addTask in interface org.apache.tools.ant.TaskContainer
        Parameters:
        task - The sub task, that shall be added.

      • add

        public void add(org.apache.tools.ant.types.ResourceCollection resourceCollection)
        This shall add the given items as sources of this task. The defined operations shall be executed for each of those given sources.

        It is not expected to use this method actively, as it is specifically defined for the access by ANT.

        Parameters:
        resourceCollection - A collection of resources, that shall be processed by this task.

      • add

        public void add(org.apache.tools.ant.util.FileNameMapper fileNameMapper)
        This shall configure the mapper used by this task, to determine the name of the generated target file. The resulting target name shall be chosen according to the rules defined in the mapper and depending on the name of the source file.

        It is not expected to use this method actively, as it is specifically defined for the access by ANT.

        Parameters:
        fileNameMapper - The mapper defining naming conventions for target files of this task.

      • add

        public void add(GroupTask task)
        This method shall add a bundled task to this task. The group shall contain, define and configure a sequence of operations.

        It is not expected to use this method actively, as it is specifically defined for the access by ANT.

        Parameters:
        task - A group task containing a sequence of webservice operations.

      • add

        public void add(UserCredentials credentials)
        Provides basic user credentials (username and password) for the authentication at the webPDF server.
        Parameters:
        credentials - The credentials task containing all necessary authentication information.

      • add

        public void add(NTCredentials credentials)
        Provides credentials for windows platforms, containing username and password and optionally the name of the user's workstation and domain name.
        Parameters:
        credentials - The credentials task containing all necessary authentication information.

      • add

        public final void add(Variable variable)
        Adds a variable to the group context. The variable and it's value shall only be known later on, when the group is executed.
        Parameters:
        variable - The variable, that shall be added.

      • setFailOnError

        public void setFailOnError(boolean failOnError)
        This will set the failOnError flag. If this flag is set to true, then a failure to execute any individual webservice will automatically interrupt the execution of the task. If set to false the failure shall be logged, but the task will attempt to execute following webservice calls, not interrupting the task.

        It is not expected to use this method actively, as it is specifically defined for the access by ANT.

        Parameters:
        failOnError - A flag indicating whether a failure to execute a webservice shall interrupt the task and prevent the execution of following webservice operations.

      • setServerUrl

        public void setServerUrl(String serverUrl)
        This will initialize an URL pointing to the webPDF server. This information is required to locate the server. This shall only contain the address and port of the server - all further URL parts will be generated automatically. (i.e.: http://127.0.0.1:8080)

        It is not expected to use this method actively, as it is specifically defined for the access by ANT.

        Parameters:
        serverUrl - An URL pointing to the webPDF server

      • setTargetDir

        public void setTargetDir(File targetDir)
        This will set the target directory all operation results shall be published to. "Operation result" is referring to the final result of called groups and will only include the results of individual webservice calls for independent and isolated operations.

        It is not expected to use this method actively, as it is specifically defined for the access by ANT.

        Parameters:
        targetDir - The path operation results shall be placed at.

      • setTargetFile

        public void setTargetFile(File targetFile)
        This will set a single file all output shall be written to. Be aware, that this shall overwrite the given file for each completed sequence of operations defined in this task.

        It is not expected to use this method actively, as it is specifically defined for the access by ANT.

        Parameters:
        targetFile - The file results shall be published to.

      • setTempDir

        public void setTempDir(File tempDir)
        This shall define the temporary directory for this task. Results that are generated in non terminal operation calls will be published to this directory and shall be deleted as soon as possible (Unless their deletion has been forbidden)

        It is not expected to use this method actively, as it is specifically defined for the access by ANT.

        Parameters:
        tempDir - The directory temporary results, of non terminal operation calls, shall be published to.
